subject: RE: ownerOrganizerID bug - Backend fix needed, not frontend
body:
Fulton,

Investigated the frontend. The bug is actually in the BACKEND, not frontend.

## Frontend Behavior (Correct)

Frontend sends ownerOrganizerID as a string in JSON:
```javascript
// CreateEventDetailModal.js line 729
ownerOrganizerID: eventData.ownerOrganizerID || user.backendInfo.regionalOrganizerInfo.organizerId
```

This is normal - JSON APIs always send ObjectIds as strings like '6806691a2f926881302124cd'.

## Backend Fix Needed

The backend endpoint handling event creation/update needs to convert string IDs to ObjectId before saving:

```javascript
// In your event POST/PUT handler
if (eventData.ownerOrganizerID && typeof eventData.ownerOrganizerID === 'string') {
  eventData.ownerOrganizerID = new mongoose.Types.ObjectId(eventData.ownerOrganizerID);
}
```

## Check These Endpoints

1. POST /api/events/post (RO event creation)
2. POST /api/events/ra/create (RA event creation)
3. PUT /api/events/:id (RO event update)
4. PUT /api/events/ra/:id (RA event update)

Let me know if you need help identifying which specific endpoints are affected.
